alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 9:47PM CDT until June 17 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Kimble County in west central Texas... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 945 PM CDT, radar indicated thunderstorms with very heavy rain which were nearly stationary over the Junction area south to the South Llano State Park. Rainfall of 2 to 3 inches has already occurred, and additional 1 to 2 inches of rainfall is expected. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Junction. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 455 and 461. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, Flatrock Ln. crossing South Llano River and crossings along County Road 410. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
